google_play_reviews.content: Great app, but you can't delete more than one article at once
The app hasn't been updated in quite a while and is missing a lot of features that are available on the web version.

Working well for me with wallabag.it and accessing via android app. But I also installed using Softaculous on my web hosting service...the web version works but try as I might I can't get any of my three android devices to connect. google_play_reviews.content: It isn't free. It costs ‚Ç¨3.
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
The app is completely free and open source, but it is just a companion app for wallabag server.
One of the suggested server options is the official wallabag.it instance, which is indeed a paid service (3‚Ç¨ for 3 month or 9‚Ç¨ for a year), but you are free to use any other option you can find (or self-host, which is a popular choice).

google_play_reviews.content: Is this app dead? Last update was over a year ago. There is still no 2-factor-authentication. In addition I'm not able to import bookmarks from firefox, over the desktop page. It looked very promising. Sad this just an other disappointment in search of a privacy friendly bookmark manager.
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
There haven't been updates in a while, but most of the things work. There is a workaround for 2FA (temporary disable 2FA for the app setup).
Issues with the web application should be reported in the main wallabag repo, if you want to get help.
Also, wallabag is not a bookmark manager (though, some may use it in a similar manner).

google_play_reviews.content: Thank you for the great app
works very well. would like to see an expanded widget view in the future but it has everything else i could want or need from a service like this.

This is a good app, but why do the tags show twice? There is one set (all lowercase) and one set normally. This seems to be s bug, and it makes it difficult to find the correct tag. Otherwise, it's good.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Try wiping the app data. If that doesn't help, the issue is on the server. The server migrated to lowercase-only tags a while back, but there could have been a migration issue, or you might have been affected by another issue related to auto tagging, which was fixed in the latest server version.

google_play_reviews.content: Good app, but I would like to see thumbnails added
Worked great, but free hosting is no longer available.
Import of articles from Pocket took a few days but worked in the end. I'm using the paid hosting on Wallabag.it, since self-hosting is not a project I need right now.
I love this thing!
Love it! A great pocket alternative with very responsive devs!
Use it with self hosted service. No problems so far. Great service.
One of the must-install apps in every phone I buy.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you!

google_play_reviews.content: Crashes in endless loop when link is shared to it.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi! Can you create an issue and provide more details? https://github.com/wallabag/android-app/issues

google_play_reviews.content: I'm a complete tech idiot but managed to get the free version to work on all of my devices I am loving it.. be nice to have some other folders and color code stuff
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for the review! Can you create an issue and explain what exactly you're missing? https://github.com/wallabag/android-app/issues

google_play_reviews.content: If you want to use it free, you must have your own web server. That said, I logged onto my admin account for domain, and there was already a wallabag plug-in available. It was a little tricky to figure out what wallabag was asking for, but the app populates everything automatically, and after going back and forth copying and pasting data, it works great. I just wish it would save an entire webpage for offline viewing. It only saves small amounts of some pages.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: You may report site-specific issues in the wallabag server repo: https://github.com/wallabag/wallabag/issues

google_play_reviews.content: Well deserves 5 stars. The app is free, and for the service behind it, either you install it for free on your server if you know how, or you just pay a cheap price of 9 Dollars/Euros a year for their Wallabag.it service (a good price.) I compared it to Pocket app which I had it premium paid for a higher price than this 9 dollars a year. It has all the main features of pocket at a cheaper price. Well done. I recommend it.
It's not free, that is a lie and it is not easy to use.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: The app is free, but it's only a companion app - it needs a wallabag web-service to work with. You can self-host it for free or you can use the official https://wallabag.it service for a moderate price (the price for which is clearly stated on the website). As for the ease of use, we're always open to suggestions on our issue tracker.

google_play_reviews.content: It is not free anymore. Lost all my stories. Now it is worthless
Totally love it
Works very well. What would be nice is a thumbnail view of all articles similar to the web interface.
Does not allow highlights or notes.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Experimental annotation support is available in the latest release. The feature is disabled by default and needs to be enabled in settings ("Settings - UI - Annotations support").

google_play_reviews.content: Dont think I could live with out this now love it
Ever since the August 20 update, login fails on the app. Error - wallabag service not found - check URL. But I can log in via browser just fine. Tried uninstalling and reinstalling, no change.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Please open an issue at https://github.com/wallabag/android-app/issues/new we need a few more details to resolve this problem

google_play_reviews.content: Counterpoint to all the one star reviews, I've been hosting my own Wallabag server for a few years and had no lasting problems. The app has had sync issues where certificates were not trusted (let'sencrypt) and the local cache had to be wiped but most of the issues people talk about are network/hosting and nothing to do with Wallabag, either end. Things can still be improved and I'd like to see soon are scrolling using the track area not just the screen but it's much the same as Pocket.
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
Thanks for a sensible review!

You should create an issue here https://github.com/wallabag/android-app/issues/new if you want to get track area scrolling working. Some additional information and testing are needed to add/fix it.

google_play_reviews.content: Good, but... can add please image preview miniatures, active tag list (under every entry) and "add new entry" button to main screen? Thanks
Docker instance not recognized. Perhaps you could share the android source code so the community can help speed up fixes and improvements
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
Hey Zack!

We applied a lot of efforts to make the experience smooth, but sometimes things break due to the self-hosted nature of wallabag server. Everyone is very welcome to help with the project here: https://github.com/wallabag/android-app/

google_play_reviews.content: had to restore a TiBu bc the latest version kept crashing. not sure what the deal is but besides that, i love wallabag

update: almost a year later and still doesn't support 2 factor auth. useless for me until then. uninstalling until it's finally added. Doesn't work at all when you have 2 factor authentication enabled. Nowhere in the app to enter the passcode that gets sent.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: It's a known issue that mostly depends on the server implementation. You can temporary disable 2FA when setting up the app and enable it afterwards.

google_play_reviews.content: Didn't work on the self hosted docker.

I just wish they‚Äôd make these apps and how to work them much easier than they currently do. I came across wallabag on an alternatives to Pocket and GrabMyBooks site and decided to give it a run, liking the fact the it was open source and free. But my problems were just about to start. First, on the Chrome version, it asks for a domain name. Well, I don‚Äôt understand such stuff about domain names, etc. I can just about turn on my the computer. So, after a time, I decided to leave the Chrome extension and give the android app a run instead; surely this would be a lot simpler; a piece of cake, I thought. I then downloaded and installed the app, only to have the same type of issues about domains for a second time. I then went online and, after a while, set up an account with wallabag and found that I could then get the app working, without knowing about domains or being a tech wizard. But then I noticed that I was on a trial period, after which, as I read it, I‚Äôd have to take out some kind of subscription to continue using the app/account. So, at this point, I deleted my account, removed the app from my phone and browser, and wished I‚Äôd never bothered in the first place. 1 star.
Merci
Works well

Hello Ernest.

google_play_reviews.content: Vague rubbish pretty useless

I'd love to use Wallabag as my main read-it-later app, because it's open-source and free (I'm using Framabag). The only deal breaker is, unlike the web app, there's no annotation feature in mobile. It's one of the things that can potentially make it a more compelling app. Also, there's no option to rename tags -- you'd have to remove a tag from all entries to automatically delete it, and then make a new tag with a different name.

Wallabag is better than Pocket in many ways.  For example, better reading view and a more accurate bookmark when returning to an article. Wallabag also includes article search as a standard feature.  For a fifth star, please implement tag renaming!
I think it brokes when I tried to save relatively long articles( not too long, ordinary medium post long)
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for your feedback. Please open an issue so we can sort this out: https://github.com/wallabag/android-app/issues

Just brilliant

I absolutely like the custom ssl and show up as browser option. Suggestion: have the option to reverse order of articles.

google_play_reviews.content: Been using it for a few weeks now. Pleased with it. Great developer engagement aswell. Looking forward to further features and improvements.
Pulls articles very fast and complete. Smooth interaction.

google_play_reviews.content: Now, I can do most of my wallabag reading on my Android. I especially like two new features: dark mode (easier on the eye) The other is sharing to Wallabag is much better now. I don't have to jump to the browser. That was a big problem is earlier version. A new great feature is text-to-speech. It's awesome.
The only thing this app still needs is search. I'm always trying to find articles that I've read so I can share them with people.

google_play_reviews.content: A huge pro is that it is open source.  All else,  it is very very limited. Maybe with funding some more features can be added but for now,  it is rough around the edges.
